description.narrative: Effective tools and strategies are in place to improve the equitability of national resource allocation, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, poor children benefit from inclusive development being a central objective of national and sectoral policies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective tools and strategies are in place to improve the equitability of national resource allocation

description.narrative: UNICEF analyzed social sector policy priorities and budget data to draft and share budget briefs around the 2020 National Budget in collaboration with MoF and relevant Ministries, Departments, and Agencies in the social sector. UNICEF also supported MOF and NDPC to improve and use composite budget monitoring tool to enable Metropolitan, Municipal and District Assemblies to report on expenditure on children's issues at the local level. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children
Citizens (including children) empowered to participate in (sub)national budget process to improve budget transparency and accountability
National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: No national analysis of child poverty

title.narrative: Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

baseline.value: Sector-specific budget briefs in some sectors

target.value: 2020:Annual budget briefs and infographics developed and shared

actual.value: 2020:Budget analysis work completed. Annual budget brief process started
